Qubit Indices (fd_greens.main.qubit_indices)

class QubitIndices(qubit_inds_data: Sequence[Union[int, str, Sequence[int]]], n_qubits: Optional[int] = None)[source]

Bases: object

A class to handle qubit indices in str, int and list forms.

Initializes a QubitIndices object.

Each qubit index can be represented in three forms: str, int or list forms. For example, ‘110’, [0, 1, 1] and 6 refer to the same qubit index. Note that the indices in str or int form follows Qiskit qubit order, but in list form follows normal qubit order.

Parameters

  • qubit_inds_data – A sequence of qubit indices in string, integer or list form.

  • n_qubits – The number padded zeroes when the input is in int form. If the input is in str or list form this is not needed.

insert_ancilla(qind_anc: Union[str, Sequence[int]], loc: Optional[Sequence[int]] = None) → fd_greens.qiskit_ver.main.qubit_indices.QubitIndices[source]

Inserts ancilla qubit indices into a QubitIndices object.

Parameters

  • qind_anc – The ancilla qubit states in string or list form.

  • loc – Location of the ancilla indices. Default to the first few locations.

Returns

The new qubit indices with ancilla qubits.

property int_form: List[int]

Returns the int form of the qubit indices.

property list_form: List[List[int]]

Returns the list form of the qubit indices.

property str_form: List[str]

Returns the str form of the qubit indices.
